data name.eng_definition: name of the data set, named by data provider

affiliation.eng_definition: contibutor's affliation (insitute's name and further definition of working place)
affiliation.data_example: Advanced Materials Research Center, KIST; Department of Energy, KAIST; Metallurgy Division, KIMS

data generation date.eng_definition: date when the data is added to the present database or data lake

note on data.eng_definition: supplemetary note on data such as data source, data owner, archive date, etc

material_(n).eng_definition: materials that can be a component of materials system

name.eng_definition: name of materials according to customary usage, designation system, composition, etc.
name.data_example: annealed INCONEL625 plate; Al7075-T6; Al10Si5Mg; Fe; CNT; TiO2; Ag; In2O2; LLZO

composition.data_example: {Pt:56.0, Ni:34.7, unit:at.%, uncertainty:0.1}; {Fe2O3:97.8, Y2O3:2.2, unit:wt.%, uncertainty:0.2}

strukturbericht designation.eng_definition: crystal structure classification system established by the Zeitschrift für Kristallographie

space group.eng_definition: space group name of the structure

(analysis_n).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis_n).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

SMILES.eng_definition: human-readable string notation for describing the structure of molecules, simplified molecular-input line-entry system
SMILES.data_example: CH4 - C; CH3CH3 - CC; CH2CH2 - C=C; CH3OCH3 - COC

process.eng_definition: material process composed of sequence of synthesis and post processing steps

(process_n).eng_definition: information of nth process, sequentially stored in array
(process_n).data_type: corresponding data module for materials process

model.eng_definition: information of the computation model in the case of compuation or simulation data

phase.eng_definition: major state of the model or major crystal structure when the model is solid

box dimension.eng_definition: dimension of simulation box in Angstrom

structure file.eng_definition: link of structure file used for compuation or simulation. File format is determined by extension of the file name

property.eng_definition: attribute, quality, or chracteristic of materials

defect.eng_definition: defect of materials ranging from 0D point defects to 2D interface

0D defect.eng_definition: defects that occur only at or around a single lattice point

formation energy.eng_definition: defect formation energy, i.e. lattice cohesive energy in the case of vacancy

(analysis_n).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis_n).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

density.eng_definition: ratio of defected lattice sites to those containig atoms

(analysis_n).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis_n).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

electric charge.eng_definition: charge state of point defecs in the unit of electron

(analysis_n).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis_n).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

1D defect.eng_definition: linear crystallographic defect or irregularity within a crystal structure which contains an abrupt change in the arrangement of atoms

Burgers vector.eng_definition: magnitude and direction of the lattice distortion resulting from a dislocation

density.eng_definition: measure of the number of dislocations in a unit volume of a crystalline material

velocity.eng_definition: velocity of mobile dislocation upon applied stress

(analysis_n).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis_n).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

2D defect.eng_definition: planar defect separating two phases or crystal lattices, each of which may be solid, liquid, or gaseous

interfacial energy.eng_definition: energy required to form a unit area of new interface

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

misorientation.eng_definition: difference in crystallographic orientation between two crystallites in a polycrystalline material

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

stacking fault energy.eng_definition: energy required to form irregularities in the sequence of crystlline planes

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

density.eng_definition: mass per unit volum of a substance

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

grain.eng_definition: inner structure of material made of individual crystalline areas

grain size.eng_definition: estimate of the average grain diameter

grain aspect ratio.eng_definition: length ratio between longest distance and shortest distance of grain

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

morphology.eng_definition: morphological data of materials of various shapes

shape.eng_definition: Particle shape of material_n if it is particulate materials
shape.data_example: sphere; rod; plate; cube, octahedron; truncated dodecahedron

size.eng_definition: Particle size of materials_n if it is particulate materials

diameter.eng_definition: average diameter of spherical or rod shaped particles

(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

name.eng_definition: name of a phase according to its thermodynamic state and/or crystal structure

composition.data_example: {Pt:56.0, Ni:34.7, unit:at.%, uncertainty:0.02};{Fe2O3:97.8, Y2O3:2.2, unit:wt.%, uncertainty:0.2}

fraction.eng_definition: relative amounts of phase_n in the microstructure
fraction.alias: phase amounts, volume fraction of phases

mechanical property.eng_definition: physical properties that a material exhibits upon the application of forces

compressive property.eng_definition: properties indicate how the material will react to forces being applied in compression

compressive yield strength.eng_definition: yield strength of material during compressive test

maximum compressive strength.eng_definition: maximum compressive strength of material during compressive test

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

creep property.eng_definition: materials response upon long-term exposure to high levels of stress that are still below the yield strength of the materials

instantaneous strain.eng_definition: immediate deformation of materials upon initial application of a stress

time to tertiary creep.eng_definition: time necessary to reach tertiary creep stage

minimum creep rate.eng_definition: slope of the portion of the creep vs. time diagram corresponding to secondary creep

rupture time.eng_definition: time necessary produce failure while materials is subjected to constant load at a constant temperature

creep strain.eng_definition: total strain after creep rupture test

reduction of area.eng_definition: proportional reduction of the cross-sectional area of a creep test piece at the plane of fracture measured after fracture

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

elastic property.eng_definition: mechanical property of a material to withstand the compression or the elongation with respect to its length

elastic constants.eng_definition: parameters expressing the relations between the stress and the strain within elastic regime

Young's modulus.eng_definition: elastic properties of materials undergoing tension or compression in one direction

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

shear modulus.eng_definition: measure of the elastic shear stiffness of a material and is defined as the ratio of shear stress to the shear strain

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

bulk modulus.eng_definition: measure of how resistant to compression that substance is

Poisson's ratio.eng_definition: ratio of transverse strain to corresponding axial strain on a material stressed along one axis

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

fatigue property.eng_definition: materials response when subjected to a cyclic load, estimated via S-N curve

fatigue life.eng_definition: number of stress (strain) cyclcles required to cause failure

fatigue limit.eng_definition: the highest stress that materials can withstand for an infinite number of cycles without breaking

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

hardness.eng_definition: measure of the resistance to localized plastic deformation induced by either mechanical indentation or abrasion

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

tensile property.eng_definition: properties indicate how the material will react to forces being applied in tension

yield strength.eng_definition: stress corresponding to the yield point at which the material begins to deform plastically

tensile strength.eng_definition: maximum stress that can be applied to the material before it breaks

uniform elongation.eng_definition: elongation at maximum load and immediately preceding the onset of necking in a tensile test

total elongation.eng_definition: percentage by which the material can be stretched before it breaks

strain hardening exponent.eng_definition: constant used in calculations relating to stress-strain bahavior in work hardening

reduction of area.eng_definition: proportional reduction of the cross-sectional area of a tensile test piece at the plane of fracture measured after fracture

(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

toughness.eng_definition: property which describes the ability of a material containing a crack to resist further fracture

impact energy.eng_definition: measure of the work done to fracture a test specimen

ductile-to-brittle transition temperatur.eng_definition: temperature at which there is a pronounced decrease in a material’s ability to absorb force without fracturing

(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

electrical property.eng_definition: physical properties that a material exhibits upon the application of electric forces

band gap bowing parameter.eng_definition: A parameter that decribes nonlinear variation of band gap between two materials with different lattice constants

band gap.eng_definition: an energy range in a solid where no electronic states can exist (between valence band and conduction band)

corrosion property.eng_definition: properties related to deterioration of a material as it reacts with its envirionment via electrochemical and chemical reactions

anodic partial current.eng_definition: sum of all the currents corresponding to anodic reactions on the electrode

cathodic partial current.eng_definition: sum of all the currents corresponding to cathodic electochemical reactions on the electrode

corrosion current.eng_definition: anodic partial current due to metal oxidation

corrosion potential.eng_definition: electrode potential of a metal in a given corrosion system

corrosion rate.eng_definition: amount of corrosion loss per year in thckness

free corrosion current.eng_definition: corrosion current at the free corrosion potential

free corrosion potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential in the absence of net (external) electrical current flowing to or from the metal surface

pasivation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential, at which the corrosion current has a peak value, and above which there is a range of potentials, where the metal is in a passive state

pasivation current.eng_definition: corrosion current at the passivation potential

pitting initiation potential.eng_definition: the lowest value of the corrosion potential at which pit initiation is possible on a passive surface in a given corrosive environment

re-activation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential below which reactivation takes place

redox potential.eng_definition: potential of a reversible oxidation-reduction reaction in a given electrolyte recorded on a S.H.E. scale

transpassivation potential.eng_definition: corrosion potential above which the metal is in the transpassive state

description.eng_definition: description of the system such as major research theme or application
description.data_example: memristive device used by Tom Hanks group; performance test on the interfacial resistance

configuration.eng_definition: configurational information of the memristive system

electrode_1.eng_definition: The lowest electrode in the structure of the memristive device

material.eng_definition: materials variable name for the bottom layer

doping.eng_definition: dopant and doping level of bottom layer

buffer_1.eng_definition: The buffer layer between the lowest electrode and the active layer in the structure of the memristive device

material.eng_definition: materials variable name for the buffer1 layer

doping.eng_definition: dopant and doping level of buffer layer

active layer_(n).eng_definition: Materials for the active layer located between the first electrode and the second electrode in a resistive random access memory

material.eng_definition: material's variable name for the active layer

doping.eng_definition: dopant and doping level of active layer_n

buffer_2.eng_definition: The process for buiding buffer layer between the lowest electrode and the active layer in the structure of the memristive device

material.eng_definition: materials variable name for the buffer2 layer

doping.eng_definition: dopant and doping level of buffer2

electrode_2.eng_definition: The uppermost part of the device's structure

material.eng_definition: materials variable name for the top layer

doping.eng_definition: dopant and doping level of electrode_2

process.eng_definition: process to build the materials system

(process_n).eng_definition: information of nth process, sequentially stored in array
(process_n).data_type: corresponding data module of the process

current.eng_definition: Values related to the current of the  device

Icc.eng_definition: Current value to set not to exceed a specific current value

Ion.eng_definition: Current value when device is on state

Ioff.eng_definition: Current value when device is off state

Iset.eng_definition: Current value when device is off state

endurance.eng_definition: The values to which the device can be written and erased

cycles.eng_definition: a complete series of processes that voltage moves and turns back

operating mechanism.eng_definition: the operating mechanism of the device

conduction mechanism.eng_definition: The conduction mechanism of the device

LRS.eng_definition: Conduction mechanism at low resistance state

HRS.eng_definition: Conduction mechanism at high resistance state

operating speed.eng_definition: The rate at which a device operates

resistance.eng_definition: Values related to the resistance of the device

retention.eng_definition: Data storage period of the device

time.eng_definition: the time that the device can withstand without degradation in performance

selectivity.eng_definition: Ability to indicate the resistive state of devices

on\/off ratio.eng_definition: The ratio of the high resistance to the low resistance of the device

voltage.eng_definition: Values related to the voltage of the device

set.eng_definition: Voltage value that makes device on-state

reset.eng_definition: Voltage value that makes devcie off-state

forming.eng_definition: Voltage value that makes conductive filament

(analysis).eng_definition: information of analysis method and condition
(analysis).data_type: corresponding data module for the analysis method

creep test.eng_definition: fundamental materials test method in which a sample is subjected to prolonged constant tension or compression loading at constant elevated temperature

instrument.eng_definition: instrument that was used during measurement of the property

temperature.eng_definition: temperature at which a given property is measured

load.eng_definition: applied load during measurement of the property

DFT.eng_definition: quantum mechanical calculations using density functional theory

code.eng_definition: DFT code used in the calculation with version information
code.data_example: VASP 5.4.4; Siesta 2.3b; Quantum Espresso; Qchem5.1; Gaussian09

calculation mode.data_example: structural optimization; electronic optimization; phonon; dfpt; AIMD

optimizer.eng_definition: type of optimizer for structural optimization

dielectric.eng_definition: dielectric constant of the solvent continuum

k-point.eng_definition: Information of k-points in the Brillouin zone

grid value.eng_definition: k-point grids for the conventional DFT calculations

k-point path for bandstructure*.eng_definition: Information of k-point path for the bandstructure calculation

high-symmetry points.eng_definition: High symmetry point along the k-point path

k-point coordinates*.eng_definition: k-point coordinates corresponding to high-symmetry points for the bandstructure calculation

number of k-points.eng_definition: Number of k-points between two high-symmetry points for the bandstructure calculation

convergence criteria.eng_definition: convergence criteria for structural and electronic optimization

symmetry.eng_definition: use of crystal symmetry in calculations

potential.eng_definition: type of pseudo potential for each element

atom.eng_definition: atom to which on-site interactions are applied

orbital.eng_definition: orbital to which on-site interactions are applied

density of state.eng_definition: information for density of state calculations

method.eng_definition: method for the Brillouin zone summation

number of energy point.eng_definition: number of energy points in given energy range

cell size.eng_definition: cell size for the finite displacement method

displacement size.eng_definition: atomic displacement size for the finite displacement method

number of displacement point.eng_definition: number of atomic displacement points for the finite displacement method

q-points.eng_definition: q-point grids for the DFPT method

optimizer.data_example: steepest descent; quasi-Newton Broyden's second method; Conjugate Gradient; Quick-Min

number of images.eng_definition: mumber of the images (intermeidate structures) for the NEB calculation

force criterion.eng_definition: force criterion for the NEB calculation

rescale step.eng_definition: number of the step to rescale the velocity

time step.eng_definition: time step for the AIMD calculation

temperature.eng_definition: temperature range for the AIMD calculation

starting temperature.eng_definition: starting temperature for the AIMD calculation

end temperature.eng_definition: final temperature for the AIMD calculation

code.eng_definition: MD code used in the simulation with version information
code.data_example: LAMMPS 2.3; AMBER; GROMACS; GULP; Materials Studio

name.eng_definition: conventional force field name unsed in the simulation
name.data_example: LJ-12; CHARMM; ReaxFF; NEMO; Tersoff; Brenner

parameter_(n).eng_definition: parameters of the potential used in the simulation

source.enf_definition: source of reference of the used force field parameters

cutoff radius.eng_definition: cutoff radius for truncating the interatomic force

time step.eng_definition: time step for integrating Newton's equation of motion

initialization.eng_definition: initial relaxation of the simulation system

temperature.eng_definition: initialization temperature to relax the model system

time.eng_definition: initialization time to relax the model system

control.eng_definition: external control acting on the simulation model

dimensional.eng_definition: change in dimension for the MD simulationn

direction.eng_definition: direction of dimension control in cartesian coordination [xyz]

thermal.eng_definition: applied thermal cycle for the MD simulation

initial temperature.eng_definition: initial temperature at which the heat treatment starts

heating rate_(n).eng_definition: rate at which temperature is raised

holding temperature_(n).eng_definition: Soaking temperature for the heat treatment

holding time_(n).eng_definition: holding time for the heat treatment at holding temperature

cooling rate_(n).eng_definition: rate at which temperature is lowered

final temperature.eng_definition: temperature when the heat treatment finished

constitutional.eng_definition: dynamic addition/removal of atom to/from the system

atom.eng_definition: element symbol of the added/removed atom or molecule

energy.eng_definition: energy of the added/removed atom or molecule

direction.eng_definition: direction of the added/removed atom or molecule

interval.eng_definition: interval between the sequential addtion or removal of atoms or molecules

total number.eng_definition: total number of added/removed atoms or molecules

trajectory.eng_definition: trajectory file name of the simulation; file format is defined by the extention of the file name

analysis.data_example: RDF; bond angle distribution; potential energy surface analysis;

fatigue test.eng_definition: mechanical testing that is performed by applying cyclic loading to a specimen or structure

instrument.eng_definition: instrument that was used during measurement of the property

temperature.eng_definition: temperature at which a given property is measured

stress range.eng_definition: algebraic difference between the maximum and minimum stresses in one cycle

strain range.eng_definition: algebraic difference between the maximum and minimum strains in one cycle

stress amplitude.eng_definition: one half of the stress range

elastic strain amplitude.eng_definition: stress amplitude divided by Young's Modulus

plastic strain amplitude.eng_definition: half-width of the strtess-strain hysteresis loops at zero stress

mean stress.eng_definition: algebraic average of the maximum and minimum stresses in one cycle

stress ratio.eng_definition: algebraic average of two specified stress values in a stress cycle

gas adsorption\/desorption isotherm.eng_definition: gas adsorption or desorption profile versus pressure at a constant temperature

temperature_(n).eng_definition: constant temperature in each isotherm measurment

instrument.data_example: iSorb HP1 | HP2 - High Pressure Gas Sorption Analyzer

instrument.eng_definition: gas chromatogrph model for faradaic efficiency

flow rate.eng_definition: flow rate of gas to be measured

type.eng_definition: method to measure hardness of materials

impact test.eng_definition: condition for evaluating the toughness of materials

type.eng_definition: type of the measurement of the toughness of materials

image.eng_definition: Raw or image data obtained from IR measurement

instrument.eng_definition: semiconductor parameter analyzer model or pulsed generator model

maximum voltage.eng_definition: Applied maximum voltage for current voltage sweep method

minimum voltage.eng_definition: Applied minimum voltage for current voltage sweep method

current.eng_definition: Applied Current for current voltage sweep method

compliance current.eng_definition: Applied Compliance Current for current voltage sweep method

pulse.eng_definition: Applied pulse for current voltage sweep method

image.eng_definition: Raw or image data obtained from NMR measurement

TEM.eng_definition: Method for analyzing material using transmission electron microscope

instrument.eng_definition: instrument that was used during measurement
instrument.TEM select: TITAN TEM; TALOS TEM; TECNAI TEM; Cryo TEM

mode.data_example: TEM BF; TEM DF; STEM HAADF; SAED; EDS; EELS

acceleration voltage.eng_definition: Acceleration voltage of electron beam generation

magnification.eng_definition: Ratio between scan area and display size

data.eng_definition: Data obtained during measurement and analysis

tensile test.eng_definition: fundamental materials test method in which a sample is subjected to a controlled tension until failure

instrument.eng_definition: instrument that was used during measurement of the property

specimen direction.eng_definition: direction of specimen with respect to the designated reference direction

temperature.eng_definition: temperature at which a given property is measured

load.eng_definition: applied load during measurement of the property

strain rate.eng_definition: change in strain (deformation) of a material with respect to time

instrument.eng_definition: continuous flow reaction for thermal activity measurment

thermogravimetric.eng_definition: mass measurement over time versus temperature

ramp rate.eng_definition: rate of temperature change in thermogravimetric measurment

flow gas.eng_definition: cycling gas type in thermogravimetric measurment

flue gas.eng_definition: information about flue gas in thermogravimetric measurment

gas type.eng_definition: flue gas type in thermogravimetric measurment

image.eng_definition: Raw or image data obtained from thermogravimetric measurement

x-ray diffraction.eng_definition: Method for analyzing crystalline material using X-ray to characterize the phase, cyrstallinity and crystalline size etc.

instrument.eng_definition: instrument that was used during measurement
instrument.data_example: PANalycal Empyrean; PANalycal X'pert Pro; Bruker D8 Advance; Bruker D8 Discover; Rigaku ATX-G; Rigaku Dmax2500

X-ray wavelength.eng_definition: Wavelength of characteristic X-ray used in measurement

Incident angle.eng_definition: Incident beam angle when the beam incidence was fixed

offset angle.eng_definition: Angle of offset from symmetric theta-2theta configuration

Scanning start angle.eng_definition: Start angle which scanning was initiated

Scanning stop angle.eng_definition: Stop angle which scanning was finished

Scan speed.eng_definition: Scan speed in case of continuous scan

Time per step.eng_definition: Scan time per data collection step in case of fixed time scan

data.eng_definition: Data obtained during measurement and analysis

centrifugation.eng_definition: materials separation process using centrifugal force

additive_(n).eng_definition: information of additive_n during centrifugation process

chemical mechanical polishing.eng_definition: Chemical mechanical polishing (CMP) is a process of smoothing surfaces with the combination of chemical and mechanical forces.

slurry concentration.eng_definition: Slurry concentration by weight can be measured by evaporating a known weight of slurry - and measure the weight of dried solids.

slurry density.eng_definition: the ratio of sum of the weight of water and additives to the volume of cement slurry.

viscosity.eng_definition: How easily a liquid flows and is a measure of the fluid’s resistance to gradual deformation by shear forces.

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

chemical synthesis.eng_definition: Theartificial execution of one or more chemical reactions in order toobtain one or more products. In modern laboratory contexts, specificchemical syntheses are both reliable and reproducible.

target material_(n).data_example: chitosan hydrogel-hydroxyapatite; inorganic porous capsules; Cu2ZnSnS4

Czochralski growth method.eng_definition: a crystal growth technology that starts with insertion of a small seed crystal into a melt in a crucible, pulling the seed upwards to obtain a single crystal.

name.eng_definition: Name of target material of process

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

electrochemical deposition.eng_definition: material deposition process by using electrochemcial reductions of target ions

amount.eng_definition: amount of precursor for the electrochemical deposition

solvent.data_example: water; mixture of water and methanol;

additive.eng_def: substances added for a specific purpose
additive.data_example: brightener; pH controller; stabilizer; complexing agent

working electrode.eng_definition: electrode on which reduction reactions occur

counter electrode.eng_definition: electrode on which oxidation reactions occur

reference electrode.eng_definition: electrode serving as a reference for potential in the electrodeoposition system

mode.data_example: CV (constant voltage or potentiostatice mode); pulse (potentiodynamic)

reduction current density.eng_definition: current density of working electrode or

mode.data_example: CC (constant current or galvanostatice mode); pulse (galvanodynamic)

atmosphere.eng_definition: atmosphere to which the electrolyte is exposed during electrochemical deposition

pH.eng_defintiion: a measure of acidity of electrolyte solution

epitaxy.eng_definition: the process of growing a crystal of a particular orientation on top of another crystal, where the orientation is determined by the underlying crystal.

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

phase.eng_definition: the state of materials to be grow on the substrate

pressure.eng_definition: the force produced by the quantity of gas or liquid in tube

exfoliation.eng_definition: Peeling the film from the layerd materials

expansion.eng_definition: process of becoming greater in size

thermomechanical process.eng_definition: metal forming process that involve control of thermal and deformation conditions

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

initial temperature.eng_definition: initial temperature at which the n-th TMP process starts

heating rate_(n).eng_definition: rate at which temperature is raised to n-th holding(or target) temperature

holding temperature_(n).eng_definition: Soaking temperature maintained during the n-th isothermal heat treatment

deformation holding_(n).eng_definition: amount of plastic deformation applied to materials at the n-th holding temperature

holding time_(n).eng_definition: holding time for the heat treatment at the n-th holding temperature

cooling rate_(n).eng_definition: rate at which temperature is lowered to the n-th final temperature

deformation cooling_(n).eng_definition: amount of plastic deformation applied to materials during cooling to the n-th final temperature

cooling method_(n).eng_definition: method of cooling without specified cooling rate

final temperature.eng_definition: temperature when the n-th TMP process finished

hydrothermal growth method.eng_definition: the various techniques of crystallizing substances from high-temperature aqueous solutions at high vapor pressures

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

ion intercalation.eng_defintion: reversible inclusion or insertion of a molecule (or ion) into layered materials

ion type.eng_definition: Types of ions used in ion intercalation

target material_(n).eng_definition: A materials that become a target in ion intercalation
target material_(n).data_example: M2C (M= Sc, Ti, V, Cr, Zr, Nb, Mo, Hf, Ta); TiO2; 2H-TaSe2

solution_(n).data_example: Ag/AgCl in 1M KOH; AgCl in 1M LiClO4; ethylene glycol (98% w/v)/water (2% w/v)

Kyropoulos growth method.eng_definition: The process of direct crystallization of melted material differed by decreasing the boule's temperature while still in the crucible.

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

lithogrtaphy_e-beam.eng_definition: lithography process using a focused electron beam to draw fine patterns

acceleration voltage.eng_definition: electric potentail used for accelerating electrons

e-beam resist.eng_definition: e-beam sensitive organic material used for fabrication of fine patterns

baking.eng_definition: baking for driving off excess e-beam resist solvent and making the pattern solid

working distance.eng_definition: distnace between the sample and the final pole piece

beam current.eng_definition: electric current used in Electron-beam lithography

dwell time.eng_definition: time that electron beam remains fixed in a single point

step size.eng_definition: the distance along x axis between two points written by electron beam

line spacing.eng_definition: the distance along y axis between two points written by electron beam

area dose.eng_definition: the quantity of electric charge per squared centimeters

lift-off.eng_definition: the process for creating patterns on the e-beam resist by removing the sacrifical layer

developer.eng_definition: a chemical that can remove the sacrifical layer with a high selectivity

light source.eng_definition: information of light source for lithography including VIS, UV and X-ray

type.eng_definition: method for making light of the specific wavelength

mask.eng_definition: an opaque plate with holes or transparencies that allow light to whine through in a defined pattern used for lithography

photoresist.eng_definition: photosensitive material for patterning or e-beam sensitive material for pattering

baking.eng_definition: baking process after PR coating to remove organic solvent remained in PR and improve the bonding of PR

contact gap.eng_definition: gap distance between mask and wafer

contact pressure.eng_definition: Pressure applied to correct mask-to-wqfer non-uniformity in contact lithography

x-ray dose.eng_definition: The intensity of the x-ray multiplied by the exposure time

threshold dose.eng_definition: maximum dose underneath absorber to avoid development

damage dose.eng_definition: maximum dose allowed at top of resist before bubble formation occurs

development dose.eng_definition: minimum dose needed at resist-substrate interface to completely dissolve the resist

PR development.eng_definition: process to make a pattern on PR by removing exposed or unexposed region of PR
PR development.data_example: lift-off; oxygen plasma ashing; organic removal

microwave-assisted synthesis.eng_definition: microwave-assisted synthesis contiditions that can be controlled during process

precursor_(n).eng_definition: Precursor for material_n for the microwave-assisted process

name.eng_definition: Name of precursor for the microwave-assisted process

amount.eng_definition: Amount of precursor for the microwave-assisted process

name.eng_definition: Name of solution for the microwave-assisted process

amount.eng_definition: Amount of solution for the microwave-assisted process

atmosphere.eng_definition: atmosphere environment for the microwave-assisted process

molecular beam epitaxy.eng_definition: A process in which a thin single crystal layer is deposited on a single crystal substrate using atomic or molecular beams generated in Knudsen cells contained in an ultra-high vacuum chamber

name.data_example: Al; In; Ga; As; Sb; P; Be; Si; GaTe

substrate temperature.eng_definition: substrate temperature at which epitaxial layers are grown by MBE

substrate orientation.eng_definition: A crystallographic orientation of substrate that influences the condensation coefficients of adatoms on substrate

substrate rotation rate.eng_definition: substrate rotation speed to improve interface sharpness and thickness uniformity of epitaxial layers

growth chamber pressure.eng_definition: A growth chamber pressure at which epitaxial growth occurs

source flux.eng_definition: Molecular beam flux of MBE source reaching a substrate

V\/III ratio.eng_definition: The ratio of Group-V source flux to Group-III source flux

growth rate.eng_definition: growth rate at which epitaxial layers are grown

growth time.eng_definition: time spent for the entire MBE growth process

growth interruption time.eng_definition: Time interval before before a heterointerface started to be grown

polishing.eng_definition: Polishing is the process of creating a smooth and shiny surface by rubbing it or by applying a chemical treatment, leaving a clean surface with a significant specular reflection

material removal rate.eng_definition: The amount of material removed per time unit

contact stress.eng_definition: localized stresses that develop as two curved surfaces come in contact and deform slightly under the imposed loads

relative velocity.eng_definition: Relative velocity between the wafer and polishing pad

Preston's coefficient.eng_definition: The dependence of the removal rate with sample composition

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

pulsed laser deposition.eng_definition: physical vapordeposition (PVD) technique where a high-powerpulsed laser beam is focused inside a vacuum chamber tostrike a target of the material that is to be deposited.

laser.eng_definition: a device that emits light through a process of optical amplification based on the stimulated emission of electromagnetic radiation.

frequency.eng_definition: The rate of repetition of a regular event

wavelength.eng_definition: The distance in metres between successive points of equal phase in a wave

fluence.eng_definition: the energy of a laser pulse divided by the area it is illuminating

energy.eng_definition: the total energy of laser per pulse

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

pressure.eng_definition: The force applied over a given area

additive_(n).eng_definition: information of additive_n during rinsing process

self-assembly.eng_definition: Self-assembly is a process in which a disordered system of pre-existing components forms an organized structure or pattern as a consequence of specific, local interactions among the components themselves, without external direction.

immersion time.eng_definition: mean time that mould immersed in semiconductor material

solution pH.eng_definition: scale used to specify the acidity or basicity of an aqueous solution.

sintering.eng_definition: powder metallurgy conditions wich can be controlled during fabrication

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

temperature.eng_definition: selected temerature to which temperature is raised, lowered or isothermally maintained

time.eng_definition: selected time to which temperature is raised, lowered or isothermally maintained

heating rate.eng_definition: rate at which temperature is raised

cooling rate.eng_definition: rate at which temperature is lowered

pressure applied.eng_definition: amount of pressure applied to materials at constant temperature or during cooling

skull crucible growth method.eng_definition: Skull melting process is a technique suitable for the growth of high-temperature crystals by radio frequency (RF) heating the raw materials and forming a thin skull around the outside of the melt as a crucible.

target material_(n).eng_definition: name of target material n of process

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

sol-gel synthesis.eng_definition: A method of synthesizing a homogeneous and high-purity solid material from a precursor such as a metal salt or metal alkoxide at room temperature or low temperature

time.eng_definition: Time of the Sol gel process

sonochemical synthesis.eng_definition: sonochemical synthesis contiditions that can be controlled during process

precursor_(n).eng_definition: Precursor for material_n in the sonochemical process

name.eng_definition: Name of precursor for the sonochemical process

amount.eng_definition: Amount of precursor for the sonochemical process

name.eng_definition: name of solution for the sonochemical process

amount.eng_definition: amount of solution for the sonochemical process

ultrasonic frequency.eng_definition: ultrasonic frequency for the sonochemical method

time.eng_definition: Time of sonication for the sonochemical method

solvothermal synthesis.eng_definition: Solvothermal synthesis contiditions that can be controlled during process

name.eng_definition: Name of reducing agent for material_n

amount.eng_definition: Amount of reducing agent for material1

time.eng_definition: Heat treatment time for material synthesis

sputter deposition.eng_definition: deposition of thin films by sputtering target materials in a vaccum chamber

base pressure.eng_definition: the lowest pressure of the processing chamber to pump down without any gas flows

working pressure.eng_definition: the pressure during the sputter deposition process

gas flow rate.eng_definition: flow rate of gas that form ionized particles in an electric field  for sputtering process

substrate distance.eng_definition: the distance between the target and the substrate

sputter power.eng_definition: electric power for the sputtering process

Verneuil growth method.eng_definition: The principle of the process involves melting a finely powdered substance using an oxyhydrogen flame, and crystallising the melted droplets into a boule.

atmosphere.eng_definition: environment to which a given process is exposed

wet etching.eng_definition: The process of cutting the material

name.eng_definition: Name of eching solution for material_n

concentration.eng_definition: concentration of eching solution for material_n

single numeric data.format: single numeric data is composed of 'value' and 'uncertainty' in the unit defined for each keyword in the dictionary

array numeric data.format: Array data is composed of 'x_definition' and 'value_array' in the form of array of objects {x, x_uncertainty, value, and value_uncertainty}. Independent parameter of the data array, x, should be defined in the 'x_definition' section in the form of array [definition, x_unit]. 'value_array' follows the 'x_definition'.

x_definition.eng_definition: define the indepedent parameter of the array

value_array.data_type: numeric array of {x, x_uncertainty, value, value_uncertainty}
